DwarvenAlchemist.synopsis:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

CheckpointGuard_001.synopsis: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
CheckpointGuard_001.how_to_trigger: - goto 77.89, 50.88, -100.36, speak with Spaw first. Agree to help them.- goto 105.40, 42.33, -119.08, speak to Myconid Warden

VB_GlutDead_1P.synopsis: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.

CheckpointGuard_000.synopsis: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.

DeepRothe.synopsis: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

VB_GlutDead_2P.synopsis: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.synopsis: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.how_to_trigger:
Repro steps:
1. Start the game.
2. goto 111.751; 46.516; -89.8
3. 3. Talk with Blurg (To trigger the Mindflayer moments, tell him about your tadpole when he asks what you're doing in the Underdark)

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.synopsis: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.synopsis: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.

AD_Myconid_004_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

AD_Myconid_003_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

ServantHookHorror_01.synopsis: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.

InjuredGnome_SporeServant.synopsis: Player speaks with Thulla - the injured gnome, - after she dies from duergar poison and is resurrected by the myconids as a spore servant.
InjuredGnome_SporeServant.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 82; 51; -984. Take 3 long rests.5. Talk with Thulla.

DirectToSovereign.synopsis: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

BroodingSovereign.synopsis:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,

CheckpointGuard_004.synopsis: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.

ServantDuergar1.synopsis: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions.synopsis: The party has heard a strange voice in their heads while exploring the depths of the Underdark They discuss it - is it their tadpole? A hallucination? Something else? They don't know.

CheckpointGuard_003.synopsis: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.

Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
RapportSpores_Alone.how_to_trigger: Have companions in partygoto 139, 50, -196Walk down into nearby purple spore cloud (scene will trigger)

AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.

DeadMyconid_Dead.synopsis: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.

MushroomField_Warning.synopsis: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.synopsis: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

CheckpointGuard_002.synopsis: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
CheckpointGuard_002.how_to_trigger: goto 29 -127Walk toward the Myconid guards up on the cliff area as illustrated.Cinematic will trigger as you get close

InjuredGnome.synopsis: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After reviewing the session descriptions and trigger details, several relationships emerge. First, the Society of Brilliance sessions have a clear cause‐and‐effect ordering: the scholar conversation (with Blurg) can lead to the mind flayer moment once you mention the tadpole, so SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar must come before SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer. Second, the sovereign myconid quest unfolds gradually. The BroodingSovereign session (in which the sovereign first appears and proposes his quest and later his shifting demands) must come before BroodingSovereign_Leave, which happens when you try to leave with him. Third, there is an ordering implied by the myconid guard encounters. In several checkpoints the myconids warn you telepathically (for example, in CheckpointGuard_002) before other “direct-to-sovereign” dialogues occur. In both the DirectToSovereign and DirectToSovereign_HookHorror sessions the prerequisite is that you have already encountered the myconid guards (as in CheckpointGuard_002). Therefore, CheckpointGuard_002 should come before either DirectToSovereign or DirectToSovereign_HookHorror. In contrast, some sessions are variants of one encounter and should not both occur in the same playthrough. For example, the two injured gnome sessions – InjuredGnome (where the gnome is in pain) and InjuredGnome_SporeServant (where she has already died and been resurrected as a spore servant) – are mutually exclusive. Likewise, the VB_GlutDead_1P and VB_GlutDead_2P sessions represent alternative outcomes of the same encounter and should be mutually exclusive. In a similar vein, the two rapport/spore sessions – one triggered when you are alone (RapportSpores_Alone) and the other when you are with companions (RapportSpores_WithCompanions) – should not both occur, and finally, the two versions of direct-to-sovereign dialogues (DirectToSovereign and DirectToSovereign_HookHorror) appear to be variants based on context and thus are mutually exclusive.

DwarvenAlchemist_0.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_0.text: Look at that. Got my useless old man back.

DwarvenAlchemist_189.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_189.text: His hands are empty as a hole - will have to send him back out soon enough.

DwarvenAlchemist_194.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_194.text: It's a miracle he survived. You should take him home.

DwarvenAlchemist_66.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_66.text: Please. Baelen's got a job to do. We can leave when he's done it.

DwarvenAlchemist_159.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_159.text: Seems like there's no love lost between the two of you.

DwarvenAlchemist_150.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_150.text: Love? Hah. Never heard of it.

DwarvenAlchemist_262.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_262.text: Baelen's meek now, but he used to be a rotten old bastard. Treated me like an old shoe for seventy years.

DwarvenAlchemist_136.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_136.text: Losing his mind was the only good he ever did by me.

DwarvenAlchemist_37.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_37.text: This is dangerous territory. You must be down here for a reason.

DwarvenAlchemist_103.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_103.text: Collecting noblestalk. Valuable mushroom. We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.

DwarvenAlchemist_53.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_53.text: Nearly nothing it can't cure. Blindness, poison, hair loss...

DwarvenAlchemist_188.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_188.text: Could it cure Baelen's memory loss?

DwarvenAlchemist_42.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_42.text: Probably. But Baelen in his right mind wasn't worth half a half of noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_111.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_111.text: I know him better than anyone. Got the scars to prove it.
DwarvenAlchemist_111.context: NodeContext: With bitterness in her voice.

DwarvenAlchemist_109.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_109.text: What about that gnome, Thulla? Could it cure her?

DwarvenAlchemist_242.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_242.text: Might do. But why bother? Thing sells in town for enough to make your eyes bulge.

DwarvenAlchemist_79.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_79.text: Ah. To no surprise of mine, you're more competent than Baelen.

DwarvenAlchemist_121.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_121.text: Go on, then. Hand it over.
DwarvenAlchemist_121.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_214.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_214.text: Why do you need it so badly?

DwarvenAlchemist_68.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_68.text: We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's in Baldur's Gate.

DwarvenAlchemist_48.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_48.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind.

DwarvenAlchemist_98.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_98.text: If I can put noblestalk on the shelves, it might allow us to hang on a little longer.

DwarvenAlchemist_216.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_216.text: What will you do with it?

DwarvenAlchemist_149.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_149.text: Sell it, what else? Worth more than its weight in gold to folk back in Baldur's Gate. There ain't much it can't cure.

DwarvenAlchemist_118.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_118.text: How much is it worth to you?

DwarvenAlchemist_127.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_127.text: Loads. But I haven't got anything to offer for it. I'm counting on this shroom for that.

DwarvenAlchemist_162.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_162.text: Now that's settled, tell me what you're really doing down here.

DwarvenAlchemist_279.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_279.text: You ought to sell the dimwit. A little hard labour could be whipped out of him.

DwarvenAlchemist_146.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_146.text: I've been tempted, but wouldn't want to damage my reputation by selling on such rubbish wares.

DwarvenAlchemist_84.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_84.text: Just leave me, I said. You've done enough damage already.

DwarvenAlchemist_139.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_139.text: Baelen's got a few minutes to get himself out of that shroom field 'fore I pack up.

DwarvenAlchemist_174.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_174.text: What are you doing down here?

DwarvenAlchemist_226.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_226.text: Right now? Waiting for my idiot husband's return. 'Less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

DwarvenAlchemist_157.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_157.text: What? Now Baelen's dead, I've got to get myself moving. Empty-handed an' all...

DwarvenAlchemist_74.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_74.text: I met Baelen in a field of deadly mushrooms.

DwarvenAlchemist_72.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_72.text: Baelen died in a field of toxic mushrooms.

DwarvenAlchemist_182.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_182.text: Away. Now. You've leeched on my misery plenty already.

DwarvenAlchemist_185.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_185.text: What? Now Baelen's dead, I've got to get myself moving.

DwarvenAlchemist_96.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_96.text: You come across a noblestalk mushroom about, you give it here. Gods know I've earned it.

DwarvenAlchemist_26.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_26.text: Why is a mushroom so important to you?

DwarvenAlchemist_144.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_144.text: We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.

DwarvenAlchemist_217.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_217.text: No point in lingering now I've got the noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_11.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_11.text: No point in lingering. Not after you swiped what we came for.

DwarvenAlchemist_206.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_206.text: We'll be clearing out, soon enough. Empty-handed, of course.

DwarvenAlchemist_221.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_221.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist_221.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist_47.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_47.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist_134.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_134.text: What are you doing down here?

DwarvenAlchemist_275.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_275.text: Right now? Waiting for that idiot Baelen's return. 'less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

DwarvenAlchemist_245.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_245.text: Right now? Waiting for my idiot husband's return. 'less you've seen him, we don't have much to discuss.

DwarvenAlchemist_100.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_100.text: There must be something else you're up to.

DwarvenAlchemist_169.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_169.text: Like I told you already - I'm waiting for that lummox, Baelen. The rest is my own business.

DwarvenAlchemist_7.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_7.text: Bald. Blue tunic. Dumb as a stick.

DwarvenAlchemist_183.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_183.text: I met him in a field of deadly mushrooms. He died there.

DwarvenAlchemist_207.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_207.text: Worthless old fool. He had one bleedin' job.

DwarvenAlchemist_187.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_187.text: My husband. Eighty soggin' years together, and he leaves me in the lurch like this.

DwarvenAlchemist_10.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_10.text: No love lost between the two of you, I gather.

DwarvenAlchemist_132.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_132.text: Baelen was a rotten old bastard. Treated me like an old shoe for seventy years before his mind started to go - softened him up, made him realise how much he needed me.

DwarvenAlchemist_152.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_152.text: Losing his mind was the only good he ever did by me.

DwarvenAlchemist_88.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_88.text: What are you doing down here?

DwarvenAlchemist_195.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_195.text: Collecting noblestalk. Valuable mushroom. We've a shop in Baldur's Gate. The locals go mad for it.

DwarvenAlchemist_222.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_222.text: Ah. To no surprise of mine, you're more competent than Baelen.

DwarvenAlchemist_223.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_223.text: Go on, then. Hand it over.
DwarvenAlchemist_223.context: NodeContext: She holds out her hand, palm open, hoping to receive the Noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_176.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_176.text: How much is it worth to you?

DwarvenAlchemist_113.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_113.text: Loads. But I haven't got anything to offer for it. I'm counting on this shroom for that.

DwarvenAlchemist_23.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_23.text: Thanking you. I'll be on my way then.

DwarvenAlchemist_160.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_160.context: NodeContext: Turns back to the player after making to leave.

DwarvenAlchemist_251.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_251.text: I do thank you. Come visit me in Baldur's Gate if you find yourself that way. We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's.

DwarvenAlchemist_225.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_225.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind. This might allow me to hang on a little longer.

DwarvenAlchemist_112.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_112.text: Why do you need it so badly?

DwarvenAlchemist_44.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_44.text: We - I - run a shop called Bonecloak's in Baldur's Gate.

DwarvenAlchemist_196.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_196.text: Baelen nearly sunk the shop to pay for drink, when he was of his own mind.

DwarvenAlchemist_65.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_65.text: If I can put noblestalk on the shelves, it might allow me to hang on a little longer.

DwarvenAlchemist_267.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_267.text: I thank you. Truly I do.

DwarvenAlchemist_78.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_78.text: You've sunk me. You and Baelen together.

DwarvenAlchemist_81.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_81.text: No point in wasting any more time here with you.

DwarvenAlchemist_135.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_135.text: That's more like it. I want you to beg.

DwarvenAlchemist_35.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_35.text: All right... please. That mushroom could change everything for me.

DwarvenAlchemist_51.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_51.text: Hold out the noblestalk to her.

DwarvenAlchemist_90.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_90.text: Oh. Thank you. I owe you more than you know.

DwarvenAlchemist_30.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_30.text: Come visit me in Baldur's Gate if you find yourself that way. Might be I can repay your kindness.

DwarvenAlchemist_18.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_18.text: Not good enough. Give me something, or I'll toss you into a chasm.

DwarvenAlchemist_142.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_142.text: Stop! Fine - take this. Wedding ring from a pillock. It has to be worth something.

DwarvenAlchemist_261.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_261.text: Give her the noblestalk in return.

DwarvenAlchemist_260.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_260.text: I'd say it was a pleasure doing business, 'cept it wasn't. Off you go.

DwarvenAlchemist_257.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_257.text: Take the reward and keep the noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_82.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_82.text: You thievin' mudsucker! I hope a cave-in breaks every bone in your carcass!

DwarvenAlchemist_272.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_272.text: I'm a businesswoman - I know a bluff when I hear it. Hand over the 'shroom or clear off.

DwarvenAlchemist_271.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_271.text: Fine, go ahead. I'll find a way to fish it back out, or get another.

DwarvenAlchemist_220.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_220.text: Not good enough. Give me something, or this noblestalk disappears right before your eyes.

DwarvenAlchemist_46.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_46.text: I know exactly what you owe. Pay up.

DwarvenAlchemist_110.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_110.text: I've changed my mind. I'm keeping it.

DwarvenAlchemist_171.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_171.text: Wretch! I did as you asked - I hope you fall down a hole and rot!

DwarvenAlchemist_278.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_278.text: Your grovelling needs work. I'm keeping this mushroom for myself.

DwarvenAlchemist_14.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_14.text: Sounds like you'll be willing to pay me for it then.

DwarvenAlchemist_198.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_198.text: Can't. Got nothing to give. Maybe if you came to see me after, in Baldur's Gate...

DwarvenAlchemist_204.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_204.text: What makes this mushroom so valuable?

DwarvenAlchemist_244.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_244.text: I've yet met an ailment it couldn't help - baldness, blindness, poison, piles...

DwarvenAlchemist_164.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_164.text: ... and best of all, it cures my dangerously underweight purse.

DwarvenAlchemist_45.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_45.text: Could it cure Baelen's memory loss?

DwarvenAlchemist_168.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_168.text: Probably. But Baelen in his right mind wasn't worth half a half of noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist_122.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_122.text: I knew him better than anyone. Got the scars to prove it.

DwarvenAlchemist_148.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_148.text: There's a sick gnome just over there. Could it cure her?

DwarvenAlchemist_258.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_258.text: Might do. But why bother? Thing sells in town for enough to make your eyes bulge.

DwarvenAlchemist_1.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_1.text: Using nature's gifts to fatten your purse is unseemly.

DwarvenAlchemist_138.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_138.text: It's a mushroom. It won't leave any starving orphans behind.

DwarvenAlchemist_177.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_177.text: Now my purse - that is starving. Needs all the fattening it can get.

DwarvenAlchemist_54.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_54.text: I've heard it has uses as a remedy.

DwarvenAlchemist_180.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_180.text: Once I get my hands on it, it'll remedy my flagging coffers.

DwarvenAlchemist_153.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_153.text: Nearly nothing it can't cure. Blindness, poison, hair loss...

DwarvenAlchemist_120.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_120.text: I'll find my way out. No point hanging around this den of misery.

DwarvenAlchemist_248.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_248.text: Now that's settled, what are you really doing down here?

DwarvenAlchemist_137.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_137.text: I met him in a field of deadly mushrooms.

DwarvenAlchemist_205.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_205.text: Bibberbang. That stupid old fool. He should know better.
DwarvenAlchemist_205.context: NodeContext: with real bitterness in her voice.

DwarvenAlchemist_253.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_253.text: My useless husband. Sent him for an errand; it's no surprise he's made a mess of it.

DwarvenAlchemist_166.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_166.text: Thought you should know. I'll try and get him out of there.

DwarvenAlchemist_231.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_231.text: I could help him - for a price.

DwarvenAlchemist_259.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_259.text: No love lost between you two, clearly.

DwarvenAlchemist_143.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_143.text: Love? Hah. Never heard of it.

DwarvenAlchemist_62.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_62.text: Did it look like he'd make it out of them bibberbang?

DwarvenAlchemist_178.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_178.text: I freed Baelen already. He should be back soon.

DwarvenAlchemist_106.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_106.text: Well that's something at least. Of course that old bugger needed help with a simple job...

DwarvenAlchemist_203.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_203.text: Good. Gods help us both if I came all the way down here for nothin'.

DwarvenAlchemist_215.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_215.text: No idea. I left it up to fate.

DwarvenAlchemist_200.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_200.text: Right. Well. I'll wait a bit longer. He'll find his way out, or he won't.

DwarvenAlchemist_209.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_209.text: My useless husband. Sent him for an errand; it's no surprise he's made a mess of it.

DwarvenAlchemist_16.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_16.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist_192.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_192.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

DwarvenAlchemist_2.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_2.text: I could look for him - for a price.

DwarvenAlchemist_173.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_173.text: Please. I know better than to promise coin to a stranger.

DwarvenAlchemist_83.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_83.text: He'll find his own way out, or he won't.

DwarvenAlchemist_125.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_125.text: I'll wait a little longer. What a bleedin' waste it'd be to come all the way down here for nothing.

DwarvenAlchemist_60.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_60.text: Bald. Blue tunic. Dumb as a stick.

DwarvenAlchemist_161.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_161.text: Where? Ach, never mind. Idiot's probably wandered someplace else since.

DwarvenAlchemist_77.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_77.text: You see him again, tell him to get back here to me. He's overdue as it is.

DwarvenAlchemist_235.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_235.text: And his pet squirrel? He goes nowhere without that little fluffball on his shoulder.

DwarvenAlchemist_212.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_212.text: Indeed. I saw both dwarf and squirrel, in the flesh.

DwarvenAlchemist_266.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_266.text: Baelen ain't got a pet squirrel and you ain't seem him, have you? Forget it.
DwarvenAlchemist_266.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

DwarvenAlchemist_131.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_131.text: Oh is that right? What colour's his tunic then?

DwarvenAlchemist_85.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_85.text: Rubbish - you haven't seen him, have you? Forget it.
DwarvenAlchemist_85.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in a lie.

DwarvenAlchemist_274.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_274.text: Green. With a very fine weave.

DwarvenAlchemist_57.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_57.text: Actually, I was mistaken. I haven't seen him.

DwarvenAlchemist_233.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_233.text: Oh, an honest mistake, was it? Never mind.

DwarvenAlchemist_25.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_25.text: Don't know. Don't care. Don't like your questions.

DwarvenAlchemist_56.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_56.text: Don't like having a sour-breath grey in my face myself, but here we are.

DwarvenAlchemist_155.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_155.text: Now answer the question or find another cranny to skulk in.

DwarvenAlchemist_28.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_28.text: Watch your tongue - you have no power here.

DwarvenAlchemist_201.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_201.text: Aye, but them myconids do, and they won't take too kindly to you kicking up a fuss. So like I said - play nice.

DwarvenAlchemist_63.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_63.text: I'm not truly a duergar - merely disguised.

DwarvenAlchemist_71.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_71.text: Hrrm. Clever disguise as long as it works. Stupid beyond belief as soon as it stops.

DwarvenAlchemist_276.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_276.text: You're daft enough to get on with Baelen. Speaking of, you haven't answered my question - seen him?

DwarvenAlchemist_193.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_193.text: I'm not truly a drow - merely disguised.

DwarvenAlchemist_239.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_239.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
DwarvenAlchemist_239.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

DwarvenAlchemist_21.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_21.text: You could always just leave him.

DwarvenAlchemist_237.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_237.text: You don't understand. You don't know what he's capable of.

DwarvenAlchemist_61.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_61.text: Maybe I can help you get away from him.

DwarvenAlchemist_252.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_252.text: You're just like him. Everyone is, in the end.

DwarvenAlchemist_38.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_38.text: It's your own fault - you took advantage of Baelen while he was unwell.

DwarvenAlchemist_133.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_133.text: Me mistreating him. You're just like him. Everyone is, in the end.

DwarvenAlchemist_197.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist_197.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

DwarvenAlchemist_227.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_227.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

DwarvenAlchemist_126.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_126.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

DwarvenAlchemist_273.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_273.text: We'll be clearing out, soon enough.

DwarvenAlchemist_264.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_264.text: Unless you want to take that lump with you, seeing as you've got the ring he gave me.

DwarvenAlchemist_256.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist_256.text: No? Thought not. Clear off then.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat_0.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat_0.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001_0.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001_0.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P_0.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P_0.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000_5.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_5.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000_14.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000_14.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000_3.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_3.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000_50.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_50.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000_4.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_4.text: I sense your fear. I've come to aid you.

CheckpointGuard_000_62.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_62.text: Focus on your parasite and connect with the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_000_36.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_36.text: *The parasite is quiet. You feel no bond with the creature.*

CheckpointGuard_000_34.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_34.text: Tell the truth of the parasite. You only seek safe passage in your search for treatment.

CheckpointGuard_000_35.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_35.text: Let me pass. I've come for the runaway gnome.

CheckpointGuard_000_38.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_38.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000_6.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_6.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000_20.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_20.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000_42.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_42.text: ((*I can mend neither skin nor spirit. but we still might commune*))

CheckpointGuard_000_43.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000_21.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_21.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

CheckpointGuard_000_65.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_65.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, poking you, warning you...*

CheckpointGuard_000_57.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_57.text: Seek understanding. Focus on the sovereign's song.

CheckpointGuard_000_27.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_27.text: *You detect a distinct quiver in every note. These creatures have experienced recent tragedy.*

CheckpointGuard_000_44.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_44.text: *You discern no information or intention in the sovereign's song.*

CheckpointGuard_000_47.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_47.text: Counter with your own memory. Duergar builders, not burners. Not rot.

CheckpointGuard_000_49.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_49.text: My purpose is private. Let me pass, and I will leave you unharmed.

CheckpointGuard_000_40.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_40.text: The Underdark is my home - I don't need your permission to pass.

CheckpointGuard_000_54.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_54.text: I have no 'purpose'. I simply am. That is enough.

CheckpointGuard_000_9.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_9.text: Hum a peaceful tune in harmony with the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_000_13.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_13.text: These tricks of the mind don't frighten me - I'll kill you!

CheckpointGuard_000_25.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000_25.text: ((*the Sovereign spoke its word. you will obey*))

CheckpointGuard_000_51.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_51.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of frenzied music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of a myconid collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000_31.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000_31.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. the Rot has come*))

CheckpointGuard_000_45.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_45.text: *The fright-choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000_70.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_70.text: ((*I am Sovereign. and you are duergar. you are Rot*))

CheckpointGuard_000_52.text: ((*I am Sovereign. and you bring the Rot. duergar*))

CheckpointGuard_000_60.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000_60.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*

CheckpointGuard_000_69.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_69.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_000_30.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_30.text: Kneel in submission. My duergar companion means you no harm.

CheckpointGuard_000_56.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000_56.text: If I wanted you dead, you would be. Don't tempt me.

DeepRothe_0.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_0.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe_0.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

DeepRothe_1.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_1.text: Should leave here before master gets lost again.
DeepRothe_1.context: NodeContext: SwA line. A simple beast of burden is pleased. His master, Baelen, has returned.

DeepRothe_2.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_2.context: NodeContext: Sound FX only - do not record

DeepRothe_3.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_3.text: Waiting for master. Miss his scratches. Can't leave without him.
DeepRothe_3.context: NodeContext: SwA line. A simple beast of burden expresses his concern. His master, Baelen, is currently missing,

DeepRothe_4.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_4.text: Want master back. He treats me good now. Doesn't kick me anymore.
DeepRothe_4.context: NodeContext: SwA line. A simple beast of burden expresses his concern. His master, Baelen, is currently missing,

DeepRothe_5.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_5.text: Hope master doesn't start kicking me again.
DeepRothe_5.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

DeepRothe_6.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe_6.text: Master is back. Good. Missed him.
DeepRothe_6.context: NodeContext: SwA line. A simple beast of burden is pleased. His master, Baelen, has returned.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat_0.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat_0.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

VB_GlutDead_2P_0.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_2P_0.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

VB_GlutDead_2P_1.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_2P_1.text: A sovereign with no subjects. Glut won't be mourned.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_39.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_39.text: Welcome back. Have you made any new discoveries?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_51.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_51.text: Welcome back. Have you made any new discoveries?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_85.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_85.text: Ah, a visitor! You're a welcome sight.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_20.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_20.text: Ah... wait. You're not with that damned raiding party. Apologies.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_130.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_130.text: But let us observe the customs of the locals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_25.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_25.text: *The scholar's brow tenses. His voice spills into your skull, the spores connecting mind to mind.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_47.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_47.text: Blurg, proud member of the Society of Brilliance, at your service.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_57.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_57.text: Hgh--nzzt. Or perhaps not. Your mind is far more complex than that of the fungi.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_50.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_50.text: I've never heard of the Society of Brilliance.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_56.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_56.text: Understandable. We are small in number, and rarely stay in one place for long.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_119.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_119.text: Your kind tend to be slaves down here.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_131.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_131.text: It's true that many of my brethren are enslaved here, but my intellect has secured my freedom.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_22.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_22.text: It is my hope that my research will lead to liberation and peace for my people.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_72.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_72.text: Such designs are part of why I've devoted myself to studying the myconids.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_79.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_79.text: I've never seen a hobgoblin like you before.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_4.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_4.text: The feeling is mutual, friend. I have only passing familiarity with the surface races.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_77.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_77.text: But I've found that there is as much to learn from an individual as there is from a community.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_38.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_38.text: So it is with the myconids: they live in harmonious unity, but each has a unique personality.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_110.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_110.text: Research in the Underdark sounds like a dangerous prospect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_161.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_161.text: Yes, but it has abundant natural resources. Spores, waterorbs, trillimac! I've studied them for years.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_157.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_157.text: *There is rare magic in the Underdark too. Faerzress. It radiates from the earth, warping teleportation and divination magic.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_53.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_53.text: This is not a wasteland: it is a glorious ecosystem. Every civilisation here could thrive without conflict!

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_52.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_52.text: It's curious to find a surface dweller here. What has brought you down so deep?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_92.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_92.text: Honestly? I kind of got lost down here.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_36.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_36.text: A common phenomenon in the Underdark, I'm afraid.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_34.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_34.text: Could I ask what you were searching for to begin with?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_49.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_49.text: I am trying to return to my people.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_97.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_97.text: You may have trouble reaching the Astral Plane from here, young gith.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_160.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_160.text: Why do you not seek refuge among your own on the surface?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_11.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_11.text: Our kind has suffered needlessly for generations. Do you also seek peace among the myconids?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_106.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_106.text: A mind flayer infected me with a tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_19.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_19.text: Truly remarkable! But why come to the Underdark, where they hold so much power?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_9.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_9.text: You were infected by an illithid tadpole? It's a miracle you're still intact!

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_83.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_83.text: You must be worried sick, but have no fear.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_81.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_81.text: I have a friend who may be able to assist.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_65.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_65.text: I hope this is important, Blurg. My zurkhwood samples need constant attention.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_62.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_62.text: It is! This adventurer has an illithid tadpole inside their head. But they haven't turned.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_164.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_164.text: No ceremorphosis? That's impossible! But intriguing.
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[gameplay reuse] Omeluum arrives and hovers

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_122.speaker: Lae'zel
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_122.text: Ghaik. Your head will make a fine trophy for my queen!

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_37.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_37.text: But I assure you, I stand with the Society of Brilliance, not the colonies of my people.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_101.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_101.text: Stifle your revulsion and listen to the mind flayer.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_150.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_150.text: I know what it's like to be shunned. I understand, Omeluum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_126.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_126.text: I've made a lot of strange allies for information. Let's hear it.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_8.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_8.text: The myconids wouldn't appreciate us fighting here. I'll listen.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_24.speaker: Lae'zel
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_24.text: They infest your head and invade your dreams, and still you would parley?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_102.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_102.text: I ask only that you refrain from violence. I respect that your opinion of my kind may be... charged.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_91.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_91.text: If that settles matters for the time being... would you like a diagnosis?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_86.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_86.text: Open your mind to me. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_93.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_93.text: Swallow your disgust and permit the ghaik's search.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_14.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_14.text: *As Omeluum's mind pierces yours, the tadpole pulses with power.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_78.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_78.text: *It feels ten times its size. Alive, awake. Almost smug.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_111.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_111.text: Relax and let Omeluum's mind search your own.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_158.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_158.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_69.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_69.text: I see. I will remain here if you change your mind.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_142.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_142.text: I want nothing to do with you.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_28.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_28.text: I'd never trust a mind flayer. Attack.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_80.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_80.text: Are you looking to have it extracted?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_31.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_31.text: Please, hold. I understand your rage against my kin.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_141.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_141.text: My species devastated and enslaved yours. It is unforgivable.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_124.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_124.text: One of my brethren forced a tadpole into your eye. Or ear, perhaps?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_137.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_137.text: I'd never trust a mind flayer. Attack.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_87.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_87.text: You'll die choking on your own bile, ghaik!

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_103.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_103.text: An illithid is your friend? How is that possible?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_127.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_127.text: I have broken free from the elder brain's yoke. I no longer serve the Grand Design.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_154.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_154.text: I ask that you refrain from violence, while I respect that your opinion of my kind may not change.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_89.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_89.text: A collective quest to eliminate the gith and enslave all other humanoids.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_104.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_104.text: I'm not refraining from anything. You'll die like the rest.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_73.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_73.text: Forgive me. Being inquisitive is in my nature.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_23.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_23.text: This is where I belong, but right now I can't stay.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_132.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_132.text: I know the feeling well. What has driven you from home?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_107.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_107.text: I collect mushrooms to sell on the surface.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_5.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_5.text: Then you've come to the right place. The hybridisation among fungi in this circle is truly unique.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_155.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_155.text: I... see. A fine way to make a living.
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_155.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_40.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_40.text: My colleagues and I are working to improve conditions in the Underdark. This need not be such a dire, hostile place.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_139.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_139.text: Our peoples aren't exactly inclined to share with each other.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_117.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_117.text: And yet, we are all in need. Imagine what creativity would bloom if no craftsman starved. If every wizard had spell materials!

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_46.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_46.text: Such is nature's balance: life thriving under adversity.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_44.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_44.text: Exactly! It's such a relief to meet another sensible mind.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_146.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_146.text: Do you have anything interesting to trade?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_129.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_129.text: I do enjoy a good bargain, if anything in my private collection is to your liking.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_163.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_163.text: Very well. I have mushrooms to catalogue.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_151.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_151.text: Seems like you've had a run-in with my people before.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_0.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_0.text: You scoundrels attacked these peaceful villagers completely unprovoked! Filthy, dim-witted...

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_71.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_71.text: Pardon. Sometimes my temper gets the better of me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_59.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_59.text: Were you here when the duergar attacked?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_120.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_120.text: I observed the fight from a distance. Combat is not my field of expertise, but the myconids handled themselves well enough.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_27.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_27.text: Can you tell me more about ceremorphosis?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_67.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_67.text: *Omeluum's tentacles flutter in what appears to be the mind flayer's approximation of a smile.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_148.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_148.text: Excellent! Omeluum will be happy to answer all of your questions.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_35.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_35.text: Do you know anything about ceremorphosis?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_133.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_133.text: A fascinating topic. May I ask the reason for your interest?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_90.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_90.text: We all have our unique interests. Mind flayers are mine.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_48.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_48.text: I see! Well, it is the central act of mind flayer reproduction.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_140.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_140.text: A tadpole is inserted into a living humanoid, and in seven days, the host is consumed to produce a new illithid.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_116.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_116.text: A fascinating process, if a touch grim.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_159.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_159.text: Can I talk to Omeluum again?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_13.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_13.text: Let me see if it will answer my summons a second time.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_112.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_112.text: Ah, the mushroom hunter! Have you made any new discoveries?

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_84.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_84.text: Ah... wait. You're not with that damned raiding party. Apologies.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_118.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_118.text: Ah, a visitor! You're a welcome sight.

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_162.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar_162.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror_0.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_HookHorror_0.text: *The monstrosity stares blankly. The voice that echoes within you belongs not to it, but the sovereign.*

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror_2.text: ((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_46.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_46.text: I greet you, child of the sun. How has your search for the mushrooms fared?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_136.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_136.text: I greet you, friend of the dark.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_139.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_139.text: Greetings. What knowledge do you seek?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_155.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_155.text: I greet you, child of the stars.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_204.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_204.text: You return. Have you changed your mind about the ring?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_273.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_273.text: How did you escape your colony?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_64.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_64.text: I was born with a propensity for arcane magic my people despise. It gave me the strength to resist the elder brain.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_138.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_138.text: Every waking hour, I pushed back against its dire hold. My wizardry empowered me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_197.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_197.text: The moment its control shattered, I fled before the colony discovered I had defected.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_145.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_145.text: Are you so keen to know my pain, young gith?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_39.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_39.text: That is not a story I share with strangers.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_268.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_268.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_6.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_6.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_166.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_166.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_160.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_160.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_89.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_89.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_199.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_199.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_19.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_19.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_15.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_15.text: I cannot change my appetites. Although I am experimenting in reducing them with magic.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_184.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_184.text: Perhaps with time, it can be one brain a year instead of one a month...

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_235.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_235.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_172.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_172.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_247.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_247.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_238.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_238.text: Swallow your disgust and permit the ghaik's search.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_67.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_67.text: Relax and allow Omeluum's mind to search yours.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_128.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_128.text: *As Omeluum's mind pierces yours, the tadpole pulses with power.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_1.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_1.text: *It feels ten times its size. Alive, awake. Almost smug.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_98.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_98.text: This is most unusual. The incubation period should be complete, as should your transformation.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_103.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_103.text: But the larva is infused with strange magic. It appears to be in some form of stasis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_294.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_294.text: No. It appears to be shielded from physical and magical influence.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_296.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_296.text: And even without the shield, the extraction would involve severe cranial trauma.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_144.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_144.text: It is not ideal. The process would surely kill you.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_59.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_59.text: Don't waste my time. Say what you mean.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_124.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_124.text: Ahem. Death. It means you would have to die first to extract the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_27.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_27.text: Extracting the larva would kill you. Immediately.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_44.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_44.text: Tell Omeluum about the strange mind flayer ship you were on.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_135.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_135.text: A nautiloid? Fascinating. I have never set foot on one myself.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_218.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_218.text: They were our warships during the greatest eras of the Illithid Empire. We ruled the entire Astral Plane from their decks.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_303.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_303.text: The design was lost when the gith rebelled and ended our dominion.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_149.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_149.text: What happens if that stasis goes away?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_291.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_291.text: I can only theorise, but I suspect your transformation would be both agonising and instantaneous.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_287.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_287.text: I thought it was always agonising, Omeluum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_289.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_289.text: Well, yes, but that wasn't my point.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_115.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_115.text: Of course. I am sorry I cannot assist you in its removal.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_126.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_126.text: Oh? Perhaps I should start taking notes.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_74.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_74.text: There may be a way to bypass that stasis. There are many alchemical substances that can influence the mind.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_181.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_181.text: Bypass? What kind of alchemy are we talking about?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_248.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_248.text: A tincture distilled from a collection of rare mushrooms. They have subtle psionic influence.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_109.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_109.text: I would require a fresh tongue of madness and timmask spores.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_203.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_203.text: But be warned. In their natural state, both of these mushrooms can be quite dangerous.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_305.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_305.text: Timmasks cause confusion in those that approach them. The tongue is... self-explanatory.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_61.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_61.text: Eating those doesn't sound like a great idea.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_97.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_97.text: My formula will hamper the more harmful effects once the mushrooms are brewed into a potion.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_215.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_215.text: Your sanity, however much you possess, should remain intact.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_113.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_113.text: Lovely. So where do I find these mushrooms?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_168.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_168.text: The Underdark, of course. Although they are quite rare, and their discovery... perilous.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_288.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_288.text: Hm. I imagine Lenore would have them in her possession. She served Mystra as a cleric.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_310.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_310.text: Why would a cleric have a bunch of dangerous mushrooms?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_206.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_206.text: She is quite fond of her garden. Lenore has always been a lonely sort - nature was her only companion.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_150.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_150.text: I offered her the chance to join the Society, but she refused. Her experiments on sussur bark took priority.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_240.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_240.text: The southwest, when I last saw her. Although her tower does have a tendency... to move.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_231.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_231.text: Good to know. I have other priorities right now.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_282.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_282.text: May your travels be safe and swift.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_283.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_283.text: In nature, of course. But I imagine the nearby cleric's tower may also grow them.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_266.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_266.text: The occupant was obsessed with magical plants. Sussur bark and the like. But no matter their source, I will take the mushrooms.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_45.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_45.text: That's too risky of an experiment for me. Count me out.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_207.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_207.text: All right. I'll come back when I find the mushrooms.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_69.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_69.text: I think I already have what you're looking for.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_312.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_312.text: Isn't the stasis why the tadpole hasn't killed me yet?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_40.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_40.text: I do not intend to shatter its protection.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_93.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_93.text: I need only bypass the interference that prevents me from communicating with the larva.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_77.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_77.text: No, I'm done with all this.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_34.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_34.text: Understandable. If you change your mind in the future, say as such. I will perform the experiment then.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_297.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_297.text: All that probing was useless in the end.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_209.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_209.text: My apologies. I hope the experience was not too unpleasant.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_154.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_154.text: Bashing my skull is just part of a day's work.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_233.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_233.text: You would not survive the outcome. The tadpole must be completely crushed, and your skull along with it.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_308.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_308.text: How severe? I have healing magic.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_32.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_32.text: I intend no disrespect, but one can only heal so much of their own brain tissue.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_35.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_35.text: But not to worry. Should you transform, I will happily perform a new examination.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_90.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_90.text: My mind is all addled, can you tell why?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_56.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_56.text: The larva is not the only creature that has been inside this brain. But at present it is the sole resident.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_176.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_176.text: Oh Gods, what do you mean?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_244.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_244.text: Your flesh has been burrowed into. Your flesh has been excavated. A tadpole need not tunnel when they greet their host.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_246.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_246.text: Damn it all, why can't I remember?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_110.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_110.text: It seems as if someone did not want you to.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_307.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_307.text: Unfortunately, beyond the assessment of my own kind, I cannot speculate what has passed through your cerebrum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_125.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_125.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_198.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_198.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_236.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_236.text: I changed my mind. What do you need to experiment on the tadpole?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_4.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_4.text: Refresh my memory - what do you need for the potion?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_78.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_78.text: A tongue of madness and the spores from a timmask mushroom.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_201.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_201.text: You may find them in nature, or the nearby cleric's tower. Be cautious - those that have taken root are quite dangerous.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_194.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_194.text: I found those mushrooms you were looking for.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_112.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_112.text: These are fine specimens. It will only take me a moment to brew them to proper potency.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_81.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_81.text: Take a look at those mushrooms yet?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_313.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_313.text: *Omeluum turns away to prepare the potion, lost in its own musings.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_134.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_134.text: You must drink the entire draught. I can make no promises as to its taste.
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_165.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_165.text: *The potion is disgusting beyond description. The only mercy is that it goes down quickly.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_178.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_178.text: Not a drop left. Very good.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_211.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_211.text: As the potion influences your mind, you may find yourself acting irrationally. Try and stay focused.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_31.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_31.text: *The world loses its edges, its finer boundaries. You are fluid but trapped, like a creature suspended in amber.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_227.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_227.text: Use meditation to clear your mind.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_277.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_277.text: *Drawing on a lifetime of practice, you centre yourself. Your body is an anchor, implacable and calm.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_277.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_281.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_281.text: Draw on your willpower and resist.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_185.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_185.text: *Dark holes bite at the edges of your vision, but the void cannot draw you in.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Darkness FX pushes in from the edge of the screen.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_169.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_169.text: *You're sinking - sinking into a starless void that has no end. The connection between mind and body draws thin and tight.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character's eyes go wide, staring off into nothing.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_306.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_306.text: Focus on the present, not the illusions.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_60.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_60.text: *A few sparks and colours dance around Omeluum, but you stay steady and staring ahead.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small colorful FX on the screen.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_158.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_158.text: *The tadpole spasms, seizes. It's fighting the potion even harder than you are.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs their head in agony, tadpole halo FX/effect in place.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_293.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_293.text: *Fear pierces your mind like knives of ice. The parasite digs deeper, as if it means to hollow out your skull.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_293.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs their head in agony, tadpole halo FX/effect in place.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_88.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_88.text: Call to your god for protection.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_22.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_22.text: Drown out the tadpole by focusing on a tune.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_38.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_38.text: Wall off your mind from the psionic seizure.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_214.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_214.text: *The cold blades lose their edge. You are stalwart, turning that tide of fear against itself.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_214.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_142.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_142.text: *The parasite swells with power - more power than you have ever felt before.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_262.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_262.text: *It surges and twists, lashing out against that which would dare to intrude.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_262.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Omeluum. The glowing effect lashes out at it.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_249.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_249.text: *The parasite in your mind quiets, pleased with itself.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_190.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_190.text: That larva is like nothing I have ever observed before. Its power is... unsettling.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_41.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_41.text: I felt it grow inside me. There's more power than ever.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_137.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_137.text: Such an outcome was not in my calculations. There is more to this being than mere stasis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_237.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_237.text: So I went through all this and the tadpole's still lodged in my brain?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_54.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_54.text: Indeed. Although I may have another solution, albeit a temporary one.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_170.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_170.text: I possess a Ring of Mind-Shielding. It prevents elder brains from noticing my presence.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_153.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_153.text: It will not remove the larva, but it will limit its influence, both positive and negative.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_213.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_213.text: I would offer it as a gift, but in truth, the ring is priceless. Is there anything you could offer me in turn?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_157.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_157.text: Why didn't you mention the ring before this potion debacle?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_30.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_30.text: Because removal seemed preferable to negation.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_299.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_299.text: And I must admit, I was curious to study the tadpole myself.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_140.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_140.text: I have gold. Will that suit?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_121.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_121.text: My research is in perpetual need of funding. Yes, I am willing to accept your coin.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_258.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_258.text: If you wish to acquire the ring later, you need only ask.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_300.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_300.text: May it serve you as well as it has served me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_75.speaker: Lae'zel
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_75.text: To deal with this abomination? Nigh unthinkable. Yet even Vlaakith herself could not deny the ring's merit.
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_75.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_219.speaker: Shadowheart
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_219.text: That thing better work. If it doesn't, I doubt you'll be in any position to complain...
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_219.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: 'I hope that was a good bargain you just made' - player just acquired a ring with magical properties.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_66.speaker: Karlach
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_66.text: Nice. Helps not to judge a book by its cover, doesn't it.
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_66.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_87.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_87.text: Of course, the larva remains. Be ever-vigilant of its growth.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_292.speaker: Astarion
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_292.text: A pretty thing. And at least it offers us some protection from the tadpole.
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_292.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: stress on 'some' - you'd prefer more protection.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_133.speaker: Wyll
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_133.text: I never thought we'd bargain with an illithid. Let's hope this ring proves invaluable.
