SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_133.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_224.speaker: Gale
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_224.text: That could mean any number of things.
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_224.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: Suspicious of the mind flayer's words.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_3.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_3.text: No, I want this power. Keep your ring.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_217.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_217.text: A bold strategy. It is not many that can defeat their own minds.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_50.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_50.text: If you require it on another occasion, merely ask.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_114.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_114.text: How about I tell you more about that nautiloid? Every last detail.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_62.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_62.text: A fascinating topic indeed. What can you tell me?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_107.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_107.text: Give a dramatic retelling of your time on the mind flayer ship.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_275.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_275.text: What a brilliant experience. To feel one step closer to my ancestors is a fine gift indeed.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_86.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_86.text: Hm. I am afraid you have not offered any information I do not already possess.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_119.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_119.text: Offer a detailed, logical analysis of the nautiloid.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_164.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_164.text: Enrich your story with details from the designs you found on the nautiloid.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_271.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_271.text: Never mind. I'm not in the mood for sharing.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_264.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_264.text: I've flown on a mind flayer ship. I can trade you details of the schematics, if you're interested.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_239.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_239.text: A nautiloid? Fascinating. I have never set foot on one myself.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_108.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_108.text: They were our warships during the greatest eras of the Illithid Empire. We ruled the entire Astral Plane from their decks.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_148.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_148.text: The design was lost when the gith rebelled and ended our dominion.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_122.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_122.text: Your people enslaved mine. The debt is yours to repay.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_52.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_52.text: I enslaved no one, and stand against such practice. I cannot surrender my own shield for nothing.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_72.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_72.text: I wouldn't be in this situation if it wasn't for a mind flayer. You owe me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_302.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_302.text: That... is true. And I cannot imagine many other mind flayers will offer restitution.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_102.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_102.text: Except... it does not seem to be on my person. Did I leave it on that last expedition somewhere? Hm.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_116.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_116.text: My apologies. I cannot trade what I do not possess.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_280.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_280.text: Your conflict is with one I have never met. This ring protects me. I cannot surrender it for free.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_29.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_29.text: Something of little value - your life.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_191.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_191.text: Either give me the ring, or I'll run you through.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_141.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_141.text: We shouldn't cause trouble, Omeluum. There are enough threats down here in the Underdark.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_232.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_232.text: Very well. I abhor violence, and would rather prevent it where possible.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_132.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_132.text: I understand the potion has put you in a... precarious condition. But I will not respond to such threats.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_65.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_65.text: Perform the tale of your adventures so far: 'The Ballad of Brains, Brine Pools and Balderdash.'

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_210.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_210.text: *As Omeluum watches your performance, something stirs in his mind, unusual for an illithid: joy.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_11.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_11.text: What's next? Cutting off my own head?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_91.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_91.text: Such crude destruction may not waylay a larva like this. But there is another possibility.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_20.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_20.text: I suppose it's not all bad. More power is better than less.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_272.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_272.text: Yet that power may grow beyond your control. I have another intermediate solution, if you are in need.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_290.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_290.text: That potion of yours could have killed me. The tadpole almost did the same.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_216.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_216.text: It holds far more power than it should. For the larva to react to my manipulations in such a way is beyond my ken.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_10.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_10.text: You were supposed to make it weaker, not stronger!

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_163.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_163.text: You have my deepest apologies. The larva did not care for my intentions.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_220.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_220.text: *A wave of psychic force batters your mind, cruel and calculating. You are nothing to it. You are small.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_220.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player buckles in pain. Tadpole halo FX/effect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_254.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_254.text: *The acidic liquid tightens your throat, burning on the way down. It's a bolt of agony straight to your stomach.*
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_254.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust, looking pained.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_73.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_73.text: What exactly is this going to do to me?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_255.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_255.text: It will lower the psionic defences around the larva. If I cannot remove it, I may still be able to tell you more about its origin.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_12.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_12.text: *Omeluum watches you with cautious intensity. It expects doubt. It expects fear.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_162.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_162.text: What aren't you telling me? Is this experiment dangerous?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_55.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_55.text: Only in that you may be a danger to yourself. What the potion may make you see or feel - I cannot determine.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_7.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_7.text: But unless you are already a step from death, it will not kill you.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_143.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_143.text: I need some time to prepare.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_8.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_8.text: Of course. Return when you are ready.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_180.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_180.text: Here. I made a potion of those mushrooms. Will this work?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_123.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_123.text: Do you still have that potion? I'm ready.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_0.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_0.text: Yes. Although it may be a touch cold by now.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_48.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_48.text: I want that ring to protect my mind.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_241.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_241.text: What shall you offer in exchange?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_58.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_58.text: Is this enough gold for it?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_120.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_120.text: There's no trusting a mind flayer. Attack.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_251.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer_251.text: I will not reward your hostility. Begone!

ServantHookHorror_01_1.speaker: Narrator
ServantHookHorror_01_1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body. It doesn't seem to notice you.*

ServantHookHorror_01_3.speaker: Narrator
ServantHookHorror_01_3.text: *The monstrosity doesn't seem to notice you.*

InjuredGnome_SporeServant_1.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant_1.text: *It is not a gnome who stands before you, but a mere husk.*

InjuredGnome_SporeServant_0.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_SporeServant_0.text: *It stands quietly, awaiting its myconid master's command.*

DirectToSovereign_1.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body.*

DirectToSovereign_0.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_0.text: *A voice drifts into your mind as you gaze upon the misshapen servant.*

DirectToSovereign_3.text: ((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

BroodingSovereign_22.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_22.text: *You consider your kin, defeated at your hand.*

BroodingSovereign_27.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_27.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign_80.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_80.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign_38.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_38.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign_75.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_75.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign_5.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_5.text: You'd turn on Spaw, who gave you shelter?

BroodingSovereign_128.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_128.text: ((*my Circle long suffered while the duergar flourished*))

BroodingSovereign_141.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_141.text: ((*I sang to Spaw for help. yet it cowered in the Grotto and let my people be slaughtered*))

BroodingSovereign_12.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_12.text: ((*choose, smooth-mind. help me grow a mighty Circle and reap the reward...*))

BroodingSovereign_49.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_49.text: ((*...or protect the precious poltroon as it waits for the Circle of Glut to devour it whole*))

BroodingSovereign_136.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_136.text: ((*a tune of division, yours forever to sing*))

BroodingSovereign_39.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_39.text: ((*a tune of division, yours to sing - three scrolls in all*))

BroodingSovereign_180.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_180.text: ((*keep your allies steady, and your foes fearful. melodies of peace, even in war*))

BroodingSovereign_89.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_89.text: Why not. Spaw's time is done.

BroodingSovereign_144.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_144.text: ((*come, then. bring me to Spaw and I will sing its doom*))

BroodingSovereign_35.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_35.text: Spaw is already dead - the circle is no more.

BroodingSovereign_126.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_126.text: I'll have no part of this.

BroodingSovereign_30.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_30.text: ((*it is my right. it is my right!*))

BroodingSovereign_18.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_18.text: *Its delicate harmonies turn to scrapes and scratches.*

BroodingSovereign_41.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_41.text: If you're so eager for blood, Glut, then let me give it to you.

BroodingSovereign_111.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_111.text: The old ways die, and something new takes its place. Intriguing.

BroodingSovereign_43.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_43.text: ((*it is time. we take death to the duergar*))

BroodingSovereign_119.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_119.text: ((*come to the Circle. I will await there*))

BroodingSovereign_42.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_42.text: It's already done - the duergar are dead.

BroodingSovereign_46.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_46.text: ((*I must see for myself. lead me to the Rot. I wish to see it fester*))

BroodingSovereign_50.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_50.text: It's already done - the duergar dealt with.

BroodingSovereign_90.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_90.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the way is clear*))

BroodingSovereign_96.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_96.text: ((*eliminate Spaw. the Circle must pay for its failures!*))

BroodingSovereign_169.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_169.text: Spaw is destroyed - the circle is no more.

BroodingSovereign_103.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_103.text: *You consider your kin, dead by your hand.*

BroodingSovereign_173.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_173.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign_108.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_108.text: ((*the Rot still spreads. let me join you, so I may cleanse it*))

BroodingSovereign_118.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_118.text: ((*King of Kings, I am. let this place be sacred: Circle Glut takes root!*))

BroodingSovereign_142.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_142.text: ((*my spawn will rise, and sing of your might. you will be called King-Bringer!*))

BroodingSovereign_167.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_167.text: ((*take my gift of song. cry it low or loud - but cry it proud, King-Bringer! so it is certain, and so you are known!*))

BroodingSovereign_82.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_82.text: *Spaw's old song falters in the myconids' minds, swallowed by a new rhythm - the song of Glut.*

BroodingSovereign_95.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_95.text: *You know it for what it is: a chant of war. Glut's reign would not be one of peace - but terror.*

BroodingSovereign_57.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_57.text: ((*you have served well, King-Bringer. but our work is not done*))

BroodingSovereign_172.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_172.text: *You see Glut's old grotto once more, but this time wreathed in flame. Amid the slaughter strides a drow.*

BroodingSovereign_45.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_45.text: ((*Nere. this is the one who brought the duergar blight. bring me his head, so that I know my new Circle is safe*))

BroodingSovereign_87.speaker: Lae'zel
BroodingSovereign_87.text: Is our sole purpose to settle this one's petty feuds?
BroodingSovereign_87.context: NodeContext: Annoyed - we're being treated like lapdogs

BroodingSovereign_104.speaker: Shadowheart
BroodingSovereign_104.text: I never thought I'd become a fungal errand girl, yet here I am.
BroodingSovereign_104.context: NodeContext: Dry. Referring to repeatedly doing tasks for a myconid (mushroom creature)

BroodingSovereign_81.speaker: Karlach
BroodingSovereign_81.text: Well, our to-do list is certainly filling out fast.

BroodingSovereign_109.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_109.text: Nere is dead, but his head is lost to me.

BroodingSovereign_65.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_65.text: ((*then you reap no reward. this will be the way*))

BroodingSovereign_137.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_137.text: I assume there'll be another reward in this for me.

BroodingSovereign_19.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_19.text: ((*you have my favour, King-Bringer. but yes - there will be riches as well*))

BroodingSovereign_1.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_1.text: ((*go. cross the lake and kill the drow*))

BroodingSovereign_105.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_105.text: ((*it is the Circle that thirsts - and Glut must slake*))

BroodingSovereign_83.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_83.text: I've had my fill of taking your orders.

BroodingSovereign_143.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_143.text: ((*you will serve, King-Bringer. to feed my Circle, if nothing else*))

BroodingSovereign_132.speaker: Astarion
BroodingSovereign_132.text: Look, I'm all for killing him, but what's in this for us?

BroodingSovereign_91.speaker: Wyll
BroodingSovereign_91.text: I'm starting to feel less a protector of the people, and more of an errand boy.
BroodingSovereign_91.context: NodeContext: Growing tired of taking orders but playing along - just a little weariness creeping in

BroodingSovereign_106.speaker: Gale
BroodingSovereign_106.text: Scarcely crowned and already issuing orders. Hail Glut, hm?

BroodingSovereign_7.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_7.text: ((*Spaw was a coward, but in one thing it was correct - the drow Nere must die*))

BroodingSovereign_67.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_67.text: ((*bring me his head - a coronation gift*))

BroodingSovereign_123.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_123.text: ((*I grow among them. yet I am not of them*))

BroodingSovereign_70.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_70.text: ((*as commanded. a capable servant you have made, King-Bringer. you have earned my favour*))

BroodingSovereign_151.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_151.text: ((*once, I sang to you of home. Look now on Glut's domain, and tell me what you see*))

BroodingSovereign_122.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_122.text: A petty little fiefdom. I will rule over grander.

BroodingSovereign_160.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_160.text: ((*you shout, but you will never sing*))

BroodingSovereign_73.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_73.text: A kingdom that I handed to you.

BroodingSovereign_170.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_170.text: ((*you have received your payment - now go. this Circle sings only the song of Glut. you are discord*))

BroodingSovereign_53.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_53.text: The same as before. One sovereign or the other, it doesn't matter.

BroodingSovereign_138.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_138.text: ((*do not feign understanding of the Circle's melody. you were a useful servant - but your service is done*))

BroodingSovereign_163.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_163.text: A circle with a bright future, thanks to you.

BroodingSovereign_101.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_101.text: ((*ah, the Circle sings to you its truth. your voice is forever welcome in our harmonies*))

BroodingSovereign_31.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_31.text: ((*...so long as you remember that it is the song of Glut*))

BroodingSovereign_146.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_146.text: ((*flesh-walker, tongue-talker. you look like the Rot, yet your presence soothes me*))

BroodingSovereign_86.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_86.text: ((*far you've come. reach into memory - tell me of home*))

BroodingSovereign_40.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_40.text: ((*reach into memory. tell me of home*))

BroodingSovereign_159.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_159.text: Make up the kind of treasured memories you expect the sane to feel.

BroodingSovereign_145.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_145.text: *It sighs, though from your hollow words, or believing your false dreams, you know not.*

BroodingSovereign_92.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_92.text: Me blanketed in flayed skin, fireplace burning flesh, sipping a glass of gall.

BroodingSovereign_88.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_88.text: *It shudders, twisted by your brutal honesty.*

BroodingSovereign_21.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_21.text: *It reveals its own home in reply: a humid cove filled with decaying myconid corpses.*
BroodingSovereign_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Glut's cove, littered with myconid corpses

BroodingSovereign_179.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_179.text: ((*duergar destroyed my people. I am a Sovereign with no Circle*))

BroodingSovereign_168.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_168.text: ((*but I have heard the song. you mean to cleanse the duergar Rot. I mean to join you*))

BroodingSovereign_51.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_51.text: Are you sure? It's going to be dangerous.

BroodingSovereign_97.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_97.text: ((*I am the danger, and I am the cure. they erased my people; I will erase theirs*))

BroodingSovereign_134.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_134.text: Join me? That depends - can you make yourself useful?

BroodingSovereign_9.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_9.text: ((*in death, your foe becomes your ally. I will raise it; you may command it*))

BroodingSovereign_164.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_164.text: What threat do you pose to duergar?

BroodingSovereign_48.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_48.text: Very well - you may join me.

BroodingSovereign_162.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_162.text: ((*remain in the Underdark, and I will follow. we cleanse the Rot together*))

BroodingSovereign_2.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_2.text: I'm not travelling with some overgrown mushroom.

BroodingSovereign_17.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_17.text: ((*a Sovereign's fate is to reign. when the day comes, you will grovel*))

BroodingSovereign_68.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_68.text: You mean to take revenge - a noble cause. Join me.

BroodingSovereign_113.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_113.text: ((*I do not belong here; I am not welcomed here*))

BroodingSovereign_140.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_140.text: My home is wherever I travel.

BroodingSovereign_47.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_47.text: Fill your heart with memories of your most treasured places.

BroodingSovereign_129.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_129.text: Envision the banks of the Chionthar: green and fertile.

BroodingSovereign_100.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_100.text: *It cringes in response to your sunny vision.*

BroodingSovereign_152.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_152.text: Imagine the bustle of the city's marketplace: the Wide.

BroodingSovereign_133.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_133.text: *The creature cringes, overwhelmed by the throngs.*

BroodingSovereign_64.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_64.text: Imagine Crèche K'liir - rocky and cold - orbiting Toril with the Tears of Selûne.

BroodingSovereign_59.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_59.text: Think back to your days in your father's family home.

BroodingSovereign_25.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_25.text: Turn your mind to the damp floor of your master's crypt.

BroodingSovereign_24.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_24.text: *It shivers in response to the deathly tomb.*

BroodingSovereign_32.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_32.text: Think of the cloister. Your sisters. The teachings. The pain.

BroodingSovereign_8.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_8.text: *It shivers in resonance with your remembered pain.*

BroodingSovereign_176.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_176.text: Imagine the battlefields of Avernus. Hell had been your home for too long.

BroodingSovereign_99.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_99.text: The Astral citadel of Tu'narath, at the court of Queen Vlaakith. That is my place.

BroodingSovereign_158.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_158.text: Wherever there's love, light, and laughter. A warm hearth doesn't hurt, either.

BroodingSovereign_10.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_10.text: A tricky concept - but home is wherever you can make it. Family, too.

BroodingSovereign_147.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_147.text: Visualise the forests of Faerûn. Your home lies there, in the dappled light between trees.

BroodingSovereign_130.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_130.text: Recall the majesty of the northern ranges, untamed and unforgiving.

BroodingSovereign_154.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_154.text: Recall the shadowed grottos and winding tunnels of the Great Rift.

BroodingSovereign_20.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_20.text: Envision vast Menzoberranzan, the city awash in Narbondel's heat-glow.

BroodingSovereign_26.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_26.text: I live at the edges. Wherever there's solitude, there's danger - but peace, too.

BroodingSovereign_77.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_77.text: Remember the oath you swore - and why you broke it.

BroodingSovereign_166.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_166.text: ((*flesh-walker, tongue-talker. you hail from the Dark - yet far you've come*))

BroodingSovereign_174.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_174.text: ((*toe-prancer. Sovereign Spaw has sung your fate*))

BroodingSovereign_60.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_60.text: ((*you will cleanse the duergar Rot. I will join you*))

ServantDuergar1_0.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_0.text: *The servant says what it can: absolutely nothing.*

ServantDuergar1_2.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_2.text: *The silent servant awaits its sovereign's orders.*

ServantDuergar1_8.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_8.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1_3.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_3.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1_7.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_7.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1_1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1_1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

ServantDuergar1_9.speaker: Player
ServantDuergar1_9.text: Attack the circle. No duergar deserves this fate.

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat_0.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat_0.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_15.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_15.text: Tell me I'm not imagining that voice.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_24.speaker: Lae'zel
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_24.text: No. And it's unlike any I've yet heard.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_4.speaker: Shadowheart
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_4.text: Careful... If we can hear it, perhaps it can hear us...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_50.speaker: Karlach
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_50.text: No. Something's coming - and if it lives down here in the dark, it won't be anything good.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_9.speaker: Astarion
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_9.text: No, someone's coming. And someone else wants us to know...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_49.speaker: Gale
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_49.text: That's a myconid. And it's warning us...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_43.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_43.text: Still your mind to this unusual voice.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_7.speaker: Lae'zel
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_7.text: Control your thoughts. It seems I'm not the only one listening.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_30.speaker: Shadowheart
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_30.text: Careful... If we can hear it, perhaps it can hear us...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_16.speaker: Karlach
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_16.text: This might be some devil's ploy. Don't listen to it.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_42.speaker: Astarion
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_42.text: You listen all you want - but it can get the hells out of my head.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_38.speaker: Gale
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_38.text: No, listen! A myconid... it's warning us.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_54.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_54.text: Something is coming. Has a devil found me at last?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_33.speaker: Lae'zel
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_33.text: Then control your thoughts, lest your mind be exploited.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_27.speaker: Shadowheart
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_27.text: Such faculties of observation you possess! I'm ready, whatever's coming...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_29.speaker: Karlach
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_29.text: Something's coming - and if it lives down here in the dark, it won't be anything good.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_2.speaker: Astarion
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_2.text: It's never good news with a mysterious voice, is it? Always 'warning, demons', never 'warning, nymphs bathing nearby'.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_53.speaker: Wyll
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_53.text: Well, when a creepy voice says 'something's coming', it's never good, is it?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_10.speaker: Gale
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_10.text: No devils here. That's a myconid. And it seems to be warning us...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_26.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_26.text: Stay silent. Could Cazador have found you?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_3.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_3.text: You think of Shar - could she be speaking to you here at last, in the dark...?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_48.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_48.text: That voice... it doesn't sound like the Urges. The Urges don't give warnings...

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_1.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_1.text: Panic: is the Butler back? You almost feel his beady eye on your back.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_18.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_18.text: Still your thoughts to this new voice.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_12.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_12.text: Pray for fortitude against the mental trespass.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_44.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_44.text: Fill your mind with the words of your oath. Drown out the voice.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_25.speaker: Karlach
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_25.text: What in the Nine Hells is that?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_28.speaker: Astarion
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_28.text: Who - what in the hells are you?

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_34.speaker: Wyll
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_34.text: Tell me you hear that voice.

RapportSpores_WithCompanions_22.speaker: Gale
RapportSpores_WithCompanions_22.text: That voice... Do you hear it too?

CheckpointGuard_003_2.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_003_2.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

AD_Myconid_005_Combat_0.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat_0.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

RapportSpores_Alone_8.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone_8.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone_25.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_25.text: Who are you? What are you?

RapportSpores_Alone_7.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_7.text: Probe your memories. What magic might this be?

RapportSpores_Alone_11.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone_11.text: *Telepathic mushroom creatures - myconids - inhabit the Underdark. You must be nearing a myconid colony.*

RapportSpores_Alone_31.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_31.text: Consider the voice. What sort of creature speaks this way?

RapportSpores_Alone_1.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_1.text: This feels familiar. Search your memories...

RapportSpores_Alone_5.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone_5.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone_16.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_16.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

RapportSpores_Alone_37.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_37.text: Still your mind. You have heard many voices - but never this one.

RapportSpores_Alone_28.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_28.text: Who's coming? Cazador's minions? Have they found me?

RapportSpores_Alone_0.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_0.text: You think of Shar - could she be speaking to you here at last, in the dark...?

RapportSpores_Alone_36.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_36.text: Ignore your tightening chest. Surely the devils hadn't found you down here?

RapportSpores_Alone_29.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_29.text: Still your thoughts to this new voice intruding on you.

RapportSpores_Alone_10.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_10.text: Pray for fortitude against this mental trespass.

RapportSpores_Alone_14.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_14.text: Fill your mind with the words of your oath. Drown out the voice.

RapportSpores_Alone_17.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_17.text: That voice... it doesn't sound like me. My mind doesn't bother giving warnings...

RapportSpores_Alone_21.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone_21.text: Panic: is the Butler back? You almost feel his beady eye upon your back.

DeadMyconid_Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_2.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_4.text: *...and you note its delicate filaments. It had been merely a child.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_20.text: *...and you note its delicate filaments. It had been merely a child.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_34.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_34.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_33.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_33.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_27.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead_27.text: These grey dwarves - what did they want here?

DeadMyconid_Dead_0.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead_0.text: Where do you keep your riches?

DeadMyconid_Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_24.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_7.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead_7.text: How do I get past the door to your treasure?

DeadMyconid_Dead_38.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead_38.text: ((*...old ones enter. Sovereign enters. no one else...*))

DeadMyconid_Dead_31.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead_31.text: What was your role in the circle?

DeadMyconid_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_21.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_8.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead_8.text: ((*...to grow. to know. to be one with the Circle...*))

DeadMyconid_Dead_39.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead_39.text: What was life in the circle like?

DeadMyconid_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_17.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_16.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead_16.text: ((*...floating, knowing, seeing, hearing. all together, never apart...*))

DeadMyconid_Dead_18.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_18.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_9.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

DeadMyconid_Dead_12.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead_12.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

MushroomField_Warning_0.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning_0.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave_0.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave_0.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave_3.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_Leave_3.text: *You recall the faerzress - the energy of the Underdark. The myconid might die if isolated from it.*

BroodingSovereign_Leave_4.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Leave_4.text: Remain in the Underdark. This myconid is useful.

BroodingSovereign_Leave_9.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Leave_9.text: Dismiss the myconid and move forward.

BroodingSovereign_Leave_16.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave_16.text: ((*I will refresh myself near Spaw's Circle*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave_5.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave_5.text: ((*it nourishes us all. the Circles, the drow - we drink of its essence*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave_1.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave_1.context: NodeContext: imply turning back with hand genstures but please keep it genralised.

BroodingSovereign_Leave_14.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_Leave_14.text: *You feel it too: the Underdark's magical energy - the faerzress - slipping from your grasp.*

CheckpointGuard_002_18.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_18.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of frenzied music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of a myconid collective.*

CheckpointGuard_002_26.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002_26.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. the Rot has come*))

CheckpointGuard_002_31.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_31.text: *The fright-choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_002_40.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_40.text: ((*I am Sovereign. and you are duergar. you are Rot*))

CheckpointGuard_002_1.text: ((*I am Sovereign. and you bring the Rot. duergar*))

CheckpointGuard_002_13.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_13.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*

CheckpointGuard_002_25.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_25.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_002_12.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_12.text: Kneel in submission. My duergar companion means you no harm.

CheckpointGuard_002_19.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_19.text: If I wanted you dead, you would be. Don't tempt me.

CheckpointGuard_002_6.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_6.text: As if you could even graze me. Stand down.

CheckpointGuard_002_46.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_46.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_002_48.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002_48.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_002_51.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_51.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_002_4.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_4.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_002_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_002_42.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_42.text: I sense your fear. I've come to aid you.

CheckpointGuard_002_0.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_0.text: Focus on your parasite and connect with the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_002_38.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_38.text: *The parasite is quiet. You feel no bond with the creature.*

CheckpointGuard_002_37.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_37.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_002_10.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_10.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_002_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_002_70.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_70.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_002_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_002_50.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_50.text: ((*I can mend neither skin nor spirit. but we still might commune*))

CheckpointGuard_002_14.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_002_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_002_24.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_24.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

CheckpointGuard_002_29.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_29.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, poking you, warning you...*

CheckpointGuard_002_22.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_22.text: Seek understanding. Focus on the sovereign's song.

CheckpointGuard_002_66.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_66.text: *You detect a distinct quiver in every note. These creatures have experienced recent tragedy.*

CheckpointGuard_002_53.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002_53.text: *You discern no information or intention in the sovereign's song.*

CheckpointGuard_002_43.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_43.text: Counter with your own memory. Duergar builders, not burners. Not rot.

CheckpointGuard_002_44.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_44.text: My purpose is private. Let me pass, and I will leave you unharmed.

CheckpointGuard_002_41.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_41.text: Never you mind. Stand down, or be knocked down.

CheckpointGuard_002_69.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_69.text: The Underdark is my home - I don't need your permission to pass.

CheckpointGuard_002_8.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_8.text: Hum a peaceful tune in harmony with the sovereign.

CheckpointGuard_002_36.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_36.text: I have no 'purpose'. I simply am. That is enough.

CheckpointGuard_002_67.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_67.text: These tricks of the mind don't frighten me - I'll kill you!

CheckpointGuard_002_47.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002_47.text: Let me pass. I've come for the runaway gnome.

CheckpointGuard_002_57.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002_57.text: ((*the Sovereign spoke its word. you will obey*))

InjuredGnome_11.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_11.context: NodeContext: She's sick and getting sicker

InjuredGnome_21.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_21.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, angry at herself, doesn't want to deal with us. (This is in her 'healed' state)

InjuredGnome_27.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_27.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
InjuredGnome_27.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome_235.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_235.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
InjuredGnome_235.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

InjuredGnome_165.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_165.text: I know about the runepowder. I think I'll steer clear.

InjuredGnome_155.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_155.text: ... no fooling you. We've some scores to settle back in the Gate, aye.
InjuredGnome_155.context: NodeContext: A beat - she's processing the fact that she didn't tell us the whole story and we STILL found out

InjuredGnome_33.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_33.text: But the Ironhands owe you a different kind of debt. Find us and we'll make good, that I promise.

InjuredGnome_18.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_18.text: Your leader is still locked up in Moonrise Towers.

InjuredGnome_2.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_2.text: Aye, I heard about Wulbren. But the cause is bigger than any one of us.
InjuredGnome_2.context: NodeContext: Deflated at the loss of Wulbren but pragmatic about carrying on

InjuredGnome_243.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_243.text: You've made sure his work is done, even if he's not there to see it. He'd be grateful.

InjuredGnome_234.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_234.text: What will you do when you return?

InjuredGnome_106.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_106.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

InjuredGnome_8.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_8.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

InjuredGnome_36.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_36.text: Ungh. Nick my boots and patch my wounds? An odd trade - but I'll take it.
InjuredGnome_36.context: NodeContext: A little resentful. Not in severe pain.

InjuredGnome_49.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_49.context: NodeContext: Terse, through gritted teeth. Assumes we have ill-intent.

InjuredGnome_57.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_57.text: *Her condition is familiar. Poison, derived from a wild weed common to the Underdark.*

InjuredGnome_139.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_139.text: *She'll need an antidote soon - most likely held by the poisoner.*

InjuredGnome_82.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_82.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her,

InjuredGnome_123.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_123.context: NodeContext: 'Your kin' spoken with a terse attitude - she probably thinks the player's the same as the duergar who wounded her, Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

InjuredGnome_91.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_91.text: Sit tight. There must be some way to cure you.

InjuredGnome_240.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_240.context: NodeContext: As if stating the obvious.

InjuredGnome_121.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_121.text: Sit tight. There must be more than one way to cure you.

InjuredGnome_171.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_171.text: If the duergar poisoned you, perhaps they have the cure.

InjuredGnome_163.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_163.context: NodeContext: Joyless 'hah',  forced through the pain

InjuredGnome_114.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_114.text: How did you end up here?

InjuredGnome_232.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_232.text: Myconids - agh! - took pity on me. Sound lads - especially since the greys gave 'em hell for it.
InjuredGnome_232.context: NodeContext: 'agh!' is a sharp jab of pain while she's mid-sentence.

InjuredGnome_74.speaker: Lae'zel
InjuredGnome_74.text: These myconids are the welcoming sort, at least where blubbering gnomes are concerned.

InjuredGnome_147.speaker: Shadowheart
InjuredGnome_147.text: Paragons of hospitality, these myconids. The druids in the grove could've learned a thing or two.
InjuredGnome_147.context: NodeContext: Mildly impressed (and throwing a little shade at the druids met previously, who were unwelcoming towards refugees)

InjuredGnome_6.speaker: Karlach
InjuredGnome_6.text: Sound shrooms. Snake druids take note.

InjuredGnome_216.speaker: Astarion
InjuredGnome_216.text: Now that's hospitality. The fungus could teach our druid friends a thing or two.

InjuredGnome_79.speaker: Wyll
InjuredGnome_79.text: These myconids are the hospitable sort. Refreshing, after our run-in with Kagha.

InjuredGnome_182.speaker: Gale
InjuredGnome_182.text: Charitable bunch, these myconids. At least more so than Kagha and her pet snake.

InjuredGnome_156.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_156.text: Consider what you know of your people's poison lore.

InjuredGnome_204.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_204.text: Consider what you know of duergar poison lore.

InjuredGnome_151.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_151.text: *Like dwarves, duergar have innate resistance to poison - and thus no need for intricate brews.*

InjuredGnome_158.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_158.text: *Though deadly if left untreated, the poison can be cured - by the antidote, or natural remedies.*

InjuredGnome_229.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_229.text: *Duergar society is shrouded in mystery. Nothing useful comes to mind.*

InjuredGnome_236.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_236.text: Consider what you know of duergar poison lore.

InjuredGnome_131.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_131.text: Give her the Elixir of Silvanus.

InjuredGnome_138.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_138.text: Ah... Gods... whatever that is... I needed it.
InjuredGnome_138.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

InjuredGnome_47.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_47.text: Give her an Elixir of Poison Resistance.

InjuredGnome_129.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_129.text: Give her the noblestalk as a cure.

InjuredGnome_34.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_34.text: Ah... Gods... whatever that is... I needed it.
InjuredGnome_34.context: NodeContext: Relief tinged with surprise as she feels her pain suddenly fading

InjuredGnome_215.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_215.context: NodeContext: No longer in severe pain, but with a suspicious undercurrent. She doesn't know who the player is or if she can trust them (especially if they are a drow or duergar).

InjuredGnome_68.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_68.text: How could I pass by? You were in pain.

InjuredGnome_73.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_73.text: No arguments there. Felt like a hook horror was sorting through my guts.
InjuredGnome_73.context: NodeContext: Tough and pragmatic. No self-pity here. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

InjuredGnome_88.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_88.text: But... ngh... that cure did the trick. Quick-sharp, too.
InjuredGnome_88.context: NodeContext: Checking in on her injuries, pleasantly surprised to feel better

InjuredGnome_108.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_108.text: I thank you for your help, but I gotta get moving - ah!
InjuredGnome_108.context: NodeContext: Strain - tries to get up but falls down again - still weak.

InjuredGnome_78.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_78.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.

InjuredGnome_63.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_63.text: *But was it truly nothing?  The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
InjuredGnome_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

InjuredGnome_237.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_237.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.

InjuredGnome_86.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

InjuredGnome_100.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_100.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
InjuredGnome_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

InjuredGnome_150.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_150.text: *Pain rushes through you from the wound on your hand. You glimpse yourself reaching to help a fellow initiate back on his feet, only to hear a female voice hiss your name in reprimand.*
InjuredGnome_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memory fragment - SH recalls being chastised foir helping another.

InjuredGnome_64.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

InjuredGnome_175.speaker: Shadowheart
InjuredGnome_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

InjuredGnome_66.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_66.text: Garl's garters, I don't have time for this. My kin need me.
InjuredGnome_66.context: NodeContext: Vehement frustration - she's healed but still too weak to move. 'Garl's garters' is a polite-ish swear in reference to gnomish god Garl Glittergold

InjuredGnome_81.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_81.text: You're in no condition to help anyone.

InjuredGnome_32.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_32.text: Maybe not... but you are. I need you to rescue my kin.
InjuredGnome_32.context: NodeContext: Begrudginly accepting, but eyeing us up

InjuredGnome_46.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_46.text: Take it easy and tell me what I can do.

InjuredGnome_9.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_9.text: ... seems you're the helping kind. All right - I need you to rescue my kin.
InjuredGnome_9.context: NodeContext: Appreciative, but a little dubious that we'd be so kind

InjuredGnome_145.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_145.text: Not charity, mind - we can pay. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in Baldur's Gate.
InjuredGnome_145.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

InjuredGnome_164.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_164.text: Focus on what I need. A reward, for starters.

InjuredGnome_154.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_154.text: You already relieved me of my boots. No hard feelings... once you use them to free my clan.
InjuredGnome_154.context: NodeContext: Snorting with amusement - we're chancing our arm but she means to enlist our help

InjuredGnome_220.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_220.text: We can pay too, don't worry. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in the city.
InjuredGnome_220.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

InjuredGnome_12.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_12.text: I owe you, sure enough. But I've nothing to give. If you were to free my kin...
InjuredGnome_12.context: NodeContext: Nodding, acknowledging her debt - but pragmatic. She can't pay us, but if we help her out her people can.

InjuredGnome_25.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_25.text: We can pay. We're Ironhand clan, best artificers in Baldur's Gate.
InjuredGnome_25.context: NodeContext: Rushing in before any protests - assuring us of payment. She's proud of her people.

InjuredGnome_140.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_140.text: We were on an expedition down here when the duergar snatched us up.

InjuredGnome_133.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_133.text: I got away, but not the others. The greys have them digging out some old ruin across the lake.

InjuredGnome_61.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_61.text: What was this expedition your clan were on?

InjuredGnome_190.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_190.text: Just mining for materials. Nothing unusual.
InjuredGnome_190.context: NodeContext: Shrug, evasive. She doesn't want to tell the truth and doesn't want us dwelling on it.

InjuredGnome_44.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_44.text: *The briefest hesitation, but enough. She's lying.*

InjuredGnome_153.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_153.text: But our work pays well. Help my clan and we'll make it worth your while. I swear.
InjuredGnome_153.context: NodeContext: Trying to seal the deal.

InjuredGnome_172.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_172.text: ... fine. It's complicated, but my clan has trouble back in the city. A blood-feud.
InjuredGnome_172.context: NodeContext: Sighing and relenting - she doesn't want to get into her people's private business, but appreciates we deserve to know something

InjuredGnome_56.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_56.text: We were searching for something to turn the tide. That's all I can say - but it's worth a lot to us. Understand?

InjuredGnome_87.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_87.text: I'm telling you we take care of our friends. That's no lie.
InjuredGnome_87.context: NodeContext: Being as honest as she can, but not trusting us with the full truth

InjuredGnome_26.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_26.text: No, I don't understand. Enough evasion and explain it.

InjuredGnome_146.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_146.text: Look. You've done me a good turn, and you deserve the truth. But that's as much of it as I can tell - I swear it.
InjuredGnome_146.context: NodeContext: Pragmatic, earnest - she wants to be honest with you but she can't . Take it or leave it.

InjuredGnome_191.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_191.text: If you need to go your own way, I respect that. But still... I'm asking.
InjuredGnome_191.context: NodeContext: Trying to be fair, but also earnest needing our help

InjuredGnome_94.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_94.text: All right. I'll free your people if I can.

InjuredGnome_50.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_50.text: Thank you. Only wish I could go with you.
InjuredGnome_50.context: NodeContext: Earnestly grateful, frustrated she's too weak to come get revenge

InjuredGnome_40.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_40.text: But here - I nabbed these boots from the greys when I ran. I'll feel better knowing you're using 'em to kick some duergar arse.
InjuredGnome_40.context: NodeContext: Handing us a pair of boots she stole from the duergar

InjuredGnome_223.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_223.text: I'll mark where I made my escape. And... wait here, I suppose. Not much choice, eh?

InjuredGnome_13.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_13.text: Sorry. You're going to have to save them yourself.

InjuredGnome_72.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_72.context: NodeContext: Disappointed but furious at herself for letting herself even expect that we'd help

InjuredGnome_16.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_16.context: NodeContext: Looking around, a little despairing

InjuredGnome_84.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_84.text: What are the duergar digging for?

InjuredGnome_98.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_98.text: Some dusty temple. It doesn't matter. They'll work my clan to death before they ever get near it.
InjuredGnome_98.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, unconcerned - wants us to focus on helping her people

InjuredGnome_70.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_70.text: Does there have to be a reason?

InjuredGnome_189.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_189.context: NodeContext: Wry. We helped her, but she's not the type to believe in do-gooders

InjuredGnome_217.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_217.text: Ngh. But I'm nearly good to get on my feet.
InjuredGnome_217.context: NodeContext: She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

InjuredGnome_126.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_126.text: It's always useful to be owed a favour.

InjuredGnome_162.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_162.text: Help? No. I just want to prolong your pain - at my hands.

InjuredGnome_55.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_55.text: Should've known - you lot're cruel to the marrow. Well I ain't suffering you easily.
InjuredGnome_55.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

InjuredGnome_159.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_159.text: I need my slaves healthy and mobile. Now up - we're leaving.

InjuredGnome_227.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_227.text: Should've - ngh - known. I'll die before I go one step with you.
InjuredGnome_227.context: NodeContext: Unsurprised to have the player turn on her. She starts forcing herself to her feet to go down with a fight.

InjuredGnome_169.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_169.text: Not all duergar are slavers, you know.

InjuredGnome_186.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_186.text: I'm not really a drow - this is just a disguise.

InjuredGnome_93.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_93.text: You're faking at being a drow? In the Underdark? I'm not sure if that's genius or suicide.
InjuredGnome_93.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

InjuredGnome_60.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_60.text: But appearances aside, glad you came along. I have to go - got kin who need me.
InjuredGnome_60.context: NodeContext: Grateful but preoccupied. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

InjuredGnome_76.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_76.text: I'm not really a duergar - this is just a disguise.

InjuredGnome_178.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_178.text: You're faking at being a duergar? In the Underdark? I'm not sure if that's genius or suicide.
InjuredGnome_178.context: NodeContext: Bemused. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

InjuredGnome_132.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_132.text: We're kin. If we don't help one another, who will?

InjuredGnome_0.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_0.text: You're right. Got my own kin need helping, as soon as I'm on my feet.
InjuredGnome_0.context: NodeContext: Grateful but preoccupied. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened. Still on the ground.

InjuredGnome_238.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_238.text: We're not all zealots - now you know.

InjuredGnome_14.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_14.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, grateful but wants to get on with things

InjuredGnome_174.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_174.text: No harm in a helping hand between Underdark folk.

InjuredGnome_109.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_109.text: You must have been away from here to think that. Not many willing to risk themselves for others right now.
InjuredGnome_109.context: NodeContext: Grateful. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

InjuredGnome_160.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_160.text: Wounded creatures attract hungry creatures. We don't need that here.

InjuredGnome_15.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_15.text: Wise. Glad to run into someone with survival at heart.
InjuredGnome_15.context: NodeContext: Appreciative of the player's pragmatism. She's on the mend. No longer in severe pain but still a little weakened.

InjuredGnome_43.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_43.text: Eye her boots. They must be the ones Gekh wants.

InjuredGnome_224.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_224.text: You're in a bad way. I could end your suffering, if you want.

InjuredGnome_30.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_30.text: Ngh. Hard to breathe. Blood's on fire...
InjuredGnome_30.context: NodeContext: Almost feverish, beginning to lose her senses

InjuredGnome_115.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_115.context: NodeContext: Quiet, through gritted teeth. Begrudgingly allowing us to kill her before the pain takes her.

InjuredGnome_142.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_142.text: Can't give up. Others need me.
InjuredGnome_142.context: NodeContext: Shaking head with defiance. In agony, but won't give up.

InjuredGnome_207.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_207.text: She's helpless. Check if she has anything worth taking.

InjuredGnome_92.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_92.text: *Mostly junk, but her boots catch your eye.*

InjuredGnome_105.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_105.context: NodeContext: No fool. She knows we're eyeing up her belongings and she's likely too weak to stop us.

InjuredGnome_29.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_29.context: NodeContext: Helpless as the player steals her boots. Talking through severe pain, Propped up against some boulders in a cavern, handing braced against a wound in her side.

InjuredGnome_113.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_113.text: She won't last long. Finish her off.

InjuredGnome_112.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_112.text: A little more rest and I'll be ready to get out of here.
InjuredGnome_112.context: NodeContext: Keen to get going as soon as she's able,

InjuredGnome_116.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_116.text: A little more rest and I'll be ready to get out of here.
InjuredGnome_116.context: NodeContext: Keen to get going as soon as she's able,

InjuredGnome_117.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_117.text: I'd be dead if it weren't for some passing stranger. Kindness is rare currency down here.
InjuredGnome_117.context: NodeContext: Impressed by the charity she received (from someone other than the person she's speaking to right now)

InjuredGnome_141.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_141.context: NodeContext: Vaguely stunned, dawning comprehension. We've healed her.

InjuredGnome_200.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_200.text: Either... I'm finally dead, or you healed me. Why?
InjuredGnome_200.context: NodeContext: Sizing up her injuries, suspicous

InjuredGnome_157.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_157.text: Mum, will you put the kettle on? I want to chat. Just us.

InjuredGnome_167.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_167.text: Argh...I'm coming along. Just not fast enough. Any word on my people?
InjuredGnome_167.context: NodeContext: Gasping at ache. Frustrated she's not healing quicker.

InjuredGnome_210.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_210.text: The duergar are all dead, but your kin didn't survive.

InjuredGnome_45.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_45.text: I found your people. I'm afraid they didn't survive.

InjuredGnome_124.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_124.text: They're... they're dead? I'm alone? No...

InjuredGnome_128.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_128.text: Phil... of course she did. Diehards for the cause, both of us. No cost too great, eh?
InjuredGnome_128.context: NodeContext: We just told her there was another gnome survivor - Thulla is bitter that their fanatacism got the others killed (in her eyes).

InjuredGnome_85.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_85.context: NodeContext: Angry at herself. 'Leave me' is half command, half pleading

InjuredGnome_71.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_71.text: I'm sorry. I did everything I could.

InjuredGnome_213.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_213.text: I should've been with them. Should've died with them. Leave me.
InjuredGnome_213.context: NodeContext: Angry at herself. 'Leave me' is half command, half pleading

InjuredGnome_231.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_231.text: What did you expect? You left them behind.

InjuredGnome_201.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_201.text: You're not alone. We'll meet again - in better circumstances, I hope.

InjuredGnome_75.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_75.text: I know you mean well, but... leave me. Please.
InjuredGnome_75.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, can't deal with us.

InjuredGnome_58.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_58.text: Don't mourn. You took your freedom - they waited for it to be handed to them.

InjuredGnome_221.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_221.text: You already know how to stand alone. You'll be fine.

InjuredGnome_137.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_137.text: I don't... I didn't mean to leave them. Leave me, please.

InjuredGnome_212.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_212.text: Remember them well. The grief will fade, but their memory need not.

InjuredGnome_241.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_241.text: I don't want memories. I want... I want them. Leave me, please.

InjuredGnome_17.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_17.text: It's Ironhand we favoured most. Seems he didn't favour us back. Leave me, please.

InjuredGnome_214.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_214.text: You're not alone. Your path home is just a little longer than theirs.

InjuredGnome_195.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_195.text: I don't want your prayers, priest. I know you mean well, but... leave me, please.

InjuredGnome_179.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_179.text: I'll send them your way. I already killed the duergar holding them captive.

InjuredGnome_24.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_24.text: I've saved them. Expect to see them here soon.

InjuredGnome_52.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_52.text: You did...? Then I owe you more than I can ever repay. Thank you.

InjuredGnome_173.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_173.text: Remind me - what do I need to do?

InjuredGnome_148.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_148.text: Like I said, save my kin. And if you kill any duergar, you won't see tears from me.
InjuredGnome_148.context: NodeContext: Reiterating what she wants us to do. On the mend.

InjuredGnome_28.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_28.text: I've killed the duergar that were hunting you.

InjuredGnome_219.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_219.text: I'm almost sorry to hear it - I hoped to have the pleasure myself.
InjuredGnome_219.context: NodeContext: Ferociously happy at what she hears

InjuredGnome_110.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_110.text: There's plenty more guarding my people. But I'd say you've made a fine start.
InjuredGnome_110.context: NodeContext: Reminding us there's more to do, hoping we kill the other duergar too

InjuredGnome_208.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_208.text: You're popular. There are some duergar hunters looking for you.

InjuredGnome_35.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_35.text: Hunters? Scavengers, more like. Waiting out there in the dark for me to die.

InjuredGnome_152.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_152.text: Course, I reckon the myconids are doing the same thing. You've seen how they put the dead to work.
InjuredGnome_152.context: NodeContext: A little rueful - she's grateful the myconids helped, but a little creeped out by them

InjuredGnome_120.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_120.text: This damned place. Once my people are free, I promise you - we will not be coming back.
InjuredGnome_120.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head - sick of the Underdark

InjuredGnome_90.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_90.text: How long before you're fit to move?

InjuredGnome_134.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_134.text: Don't know. Longer than I'd like. But a slow recovery's still a recovery.

InjuredGnome_184.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_184.text: Damn thief. Just leave me be.
InjuredGnome_184.context: NodeContext: Angry at us, but still poisoned. We stole from her and she's helpless to do anything about it.

InjuredGnome_188.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_188.text: What? You see to your affairs, I'll see to mine.
InjuredGnome_188.context: NodeContext: Annoyed - we refused to help her previously

InjuredGnome_181.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_181.context: NodeContext: Sounding us out - still annoyed, but pragmatic enough to know she needs us

InjuredGnome_228.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome_228.text: On the mend now, thanks to a stranger. Much longer and I'd have been with Earthcaller.
InjuredGnome_228.context: NodeContext: Impressed by the charity she received (from someone other than the person she's speaking to right now)
